message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a novel approach for solving the person re-identification problem using a deep convolution neural network with a gradient-based attention mechanism. This involves processing parts of the input image with high resolution while perceiving the surrounding image in low resolution. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves training the model to selectively focus on parts of the input image, which suggests that it may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also evaluates its proposed method on challenging datasets, which suggests that it may belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the use of deep learning techniques in the proposed approach suggests that it may also belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category.
